sense.name: enter into an official record, make record, enroll
sense.examples: We registered at the hotel. Did you register for your courses? I want to register a complaint to the manager. If you didn't get a notice, you may not be registered in a party. I would like to register this mail. The disputed domain names were registered for the legitimate purpose of attracting people to the town. Check CUConnect for confirmation of whether you were registered for the selected courses.

sense.name: be aware of, enter into someone's consciousness
sense.examples: Did this event register in your parent's minds? Did you register any changes when I pressed the button? I registered the time before moving on.

sense.name: indicate a measurement
sense.examples: The thermometer registered 13 degrees below zero. His reading ability was registered at the fifth-grade level. The Bulldogs registered a two-round 601 team score (+33) on the par 72 Currie East.

sense.name: show in one's face
sense.examples: Her surprise did not register. A shadow of his confusion registered on his countenance.

sense.name: manipulate the registers of a musical instrument
sense.examples: I have registered it on the harpsichord using the two manuals. She registered the organ and began to play again.
